page.title: 14GAMES CHILDREN PLAY
page.content: In different parts of the world the same games are being played like: hopscotch, rounders, Queenie Queenie, British bulldog, cat and mouse and skipping. Here are 2 games we play at Aldborough: Hopscotch- you start the game by throwing a stone on No.1 and you hop and jump to the highest number and come all the way back again to pick up your stone.Then start again on No.2. If you don't get the stone on No.2 you have to put your stone back on No.2 and you let somebody else have a go. Not many boys play hopscotch. Skipping- it is a very easy game-all you need is a longish rope then you get two people to hold the ends and turn it.You jump in the middle and sing some songs.
